meanings.definition: The detailed structure of a biological cell or tissue that can be seen only with an electron microscope.
meanings.sent1: Under the electron microscope, the ultrastructure of the cell revealed intricate details.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ultrastructure of cells to understand their functions better.
meanings.sent3: The tiny aliens marveled at the ultrastructure of the human cell, mistaking it for a city.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like the ultrastructure of a cell, complex and full of hidden wonders.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the ultrastructure was breathtaking, like a miniature world within a world.

meanings.definition: The fine structure of a material or substance that is visible at a microscopic level.
meanings.sent1: Examining the ultrastructure of the material required a powerful microscope.
meanings.sent2: The ultrastructure of the substance revealed its composition in detail.
meanings.sent3: The detective analyzed the ultrastructure of the fabric to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His argument had the ultrastructure of a fragile crystal, easily shattered by logic.
meanings.sent5: The ultrastructure of the snowflake was delicate and intricate, like a work of art.
